title: How to Make Placemats by Weaving Paper Strips

steps.title: Get inspired and choose materials.
steps.content: Get inspired and choose materials. To get yourself started, you may want to visit a craft store. You can weave placemats out of ribbons, construction paper, heavier types of paper, and incorporate decorative materials like glitter, sequins, the sky is the limit. When you are done collecting supplies, be sure you have at least the basics - scissors, construction paper, glue, ruler, and laminating sheets if you want to preserve your placemats.

steps.title: Cut one inch (2.5 cm) wide strips
steps.content: Cut one inch (2.5 cm) wide strips of construction paper (your choice of colors). Start by cutting long strips in your chosen colors. For this tutorial, it is recommended that you cut 9 strips that are 12 inches in length. (Use the ruler.)

steps.title: Cut the next batch of strips shorter than the first batch.
steps.content: Cut the next batch of strips shorter than the first batch. Because you have 9 strips that are 1 inch wide, each strip in this next batch needs to be 9 inches long to create rectangle.

steps.title: Place the long strips
steps.content: Place the long strips horizontally and weave the short strips vertically. Glue or tape the ends of horizontal strips to one of the vertical strips, alternating top and bottom attachments. Weave the remaining vertical strips, securing their ends to the top and bottom horizontal strips.

steps.title: Trim the edges.
steps.content: Trim the edges. Alternately, you can cut the strips a bit long to start with, and leave the ends sticking out a bit, on purpose.

steps.title: Laminate if desired.
steps.content: Laminate if desired. You can cover this project with clear contact paper to protect it for longer use, whether or not you mat it.

steps.title: Review the steps presented in Method One to be sure you are familiar with how to weave a placemat.
steps.content: Review the steps presented in Method One to be sure you are familiar with how to weave a placemat.

steps.title: Weave your placemat following the instructions in Method One.
steps.content: Weave your placemat following the instructions in Method One.

steps.title: Decorate your placemat with craft supplies.
steps.content: Decorate your placemat with craft supplies. Add glitter, stickers, drawings, or cut outs from magazines to create a collage.

steps.title: To create a chess board, choose two colors (light and dark choices are suggested for contrast) of construction paper or heavier material like felt or cardboard.
steps.content: To create a chess board, choose two colors (light and dark choices are suggested for contrast) of construction paper or heavier material like felt or cardboard.

steps.title: Cut 8 strips of the light colored material where all the strips are 2 1/2 inches by 18 1/2 inches long.
steps.content: Cut 8 strips of the light colored material where all the strips are 2 1/2 inches by 18 1/2 inches long.

steps.title: Repeat the cutting process for the dark colored material, creating the same number of strips with the same dimensions.
steps.content: Repeat the cutting process for the dark colored material, creating the same number of strips with the same dimensions.

steps.title: Place the dark colored strips in a row, lining up the edges.
steps.content: Place the dark colored strips in a row, lining up the edges.

steps.title: Weave the strips as described in Method One.
steps.content: Weave the strips as described in Method One.
